Documentation¶

Linear regression functions.

regression.least_squares(matrix_a, vector_y)[source]¶

Method computing the least squares solution min_x ||y - Ax||^2.

Parameters:
  • matrix_a – (np.matrix) matrix A in y - Ax
  • vector_y – (array) vector y in y - Ax
Return array:

vector x solution of least squares
regression.least_squares_gradient(matrix_a, vector_y, max_iterations=100, tolerance=1e-06)[source]¶

Method computing the least squares solution of the problem : min_x ||y - Ax||^2 using the gradient descent algorithm.

Parameters:
  • matrix_a – (np.matrix) matrix A in y - Ax
  • vector_y – (array) vector y in y - Ax
  • max_iterations – (optional)(int) number of iterations before stopping if the algorithm doesn’t converge
  • tolerance – (optional)(float) tolerance of the convergence criteria
Return array:

vector x solution of least squares
Raises:
  • ValueError – raises an exception if max_iterations < 0
  • ValueError – raises an exception if tolerance < 0
regression.tikhonov_regularization(matrix_a, vector_y, lambda_parameter)[source]¶

The standard approach to solve Ax=y (x is unknown) is ordinary least squares linear regression. However if no x satisfies the equation or more than one x does – that is the solution is not unique – the problem is said to be ill-posed. In such cases, ordinary least squares estimation leads to an overdetermined (over-fitted), or more often an underdetermined (under-fitted) system of equations.

The Tikhonov regularization is a tradeoff between the least squares solution and the minimization of the L2-norm of the output x (L2-norm = sum of squared values of the vector x).

The parameter lambda tells how close to the least squares solution the output x will be; a large lambda will make x close to L2-norm(x)=0, while a small lambda will approach the least squares solution (typically running the function with lambda=0 will behave like the normal leat_squares() method). The solution is given by x = (A’A + lambda^2 I)^-1 A’y, where I is the identity matrix and A’ the transpose of A.

Raises a ValueError if lambda < 0.

Parameters:
  • matrix_a – (np.matrix) matrix A in y - Ax
  • vector_y – (array) vector y in y - Ax
  • lambda – (int) lambda parameter to regulate the tradeoff
Return array:

vector_x solution of Tikhonov regularization
Raises:

ValueError – raises an exception if lambda_parameter < 0
